question_sentence: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin was convicted Tuesday in the death of George Floyd. How many charges was he convicted on?
The Senate voted Thursday to pass a hate crime bill protecting Asian Americans. Who was the only senator to vote against the bill?
On Earth Day, President Biden announced an ambitious plan to cut U.S. greenhouse gas emissions by what percentage by 2030?
A report released this week by the American Lung Association revealed that this many Americans are exposed to polluted air every day.
What country now leads the world in daily new COVID-19 infections?
Which isn’t one of the products Apple announced this week?
After more than 200,000 people signed a Change.org petition, “Jeopardy!” announced this star as one of its next guest hosts.
The European Super League, formed by soccer clubs that announced splitting from their own leagues, collapsed after how many days?
Would this year’s Oscar best picture nominees meet the Academy’s 2024 inclusion standards?
What is the name of the cryptocurrency, based on a meme starring a shiba inu, that was trending this week?
Who described Boris Johnson’s government as a ‘cesspit’ after being sacked from his ministerial role this week?
Which country has expelled 18 Russian diplomats over suspicions that the Kremlin was behind a 2014 explosion at an ammunition depot?
Sinn Fein president Mary Lou McDonald this week apologised for the IRA’s murder of which public figure?
Which phrase was used by Boris Johnson in a leaked text to James Dyson about the tax status of the British entrepreneur’s employees?
choices: ‘This will not be a problem for you.’
‘They won’t have to pay a penny more.’

question_sentence: What is the name of the Real Madrid president who insisted controversial plans for a European Super League were ‘not dead’ despite the withdrawal of major clubs?
Which small Asian nation has become a vaccine world leader after inoculating more than half of its population against Covid in just seven days?
Which supermarket chain has been fined £7.56m for selling out-of-date food at three stores in Birmingham?
What is the name of the Democrat-backed legislation designed to reform US policing in the wake of the conviction of Derek Chauvin for George Floyd’s murder?
choices: George Floyd Justice in Policing Act

question_sentence: A report commissioned by the Rwandan government has accused which country of bearing ‘significant responsibility’ for the 1994 genocide?
What is the name of the German Green Party’s newly nominated candidate for chancellor in the country’s upcoming federal election?
Which country is experiencing a devastating second coronavirus wave and has recorded world-record highs for single-day Covid-19 case numbers in the past week?
evidence: India has now recorded more than 16 million total cases of coronavirus, making it second only to the US in case numbers, surpassing Brazil.

question_sentence: NASA’s Ingenuity completed a historic feat on the surface of Mars this week. What did the craft do?
evidence: NASA’s Ingenuity is a helicopter, and it completed the first powered, controlled flight on another planet. It will complete up to four such flights during its time on the Red Planet with its other NASA travel companion, the Perseverance rover.

question_sentence: Former Vice President Walter Mondale passed away this week at the age of 93. Under which President did he service?
evidence: Mondale was vice president to Jimmy Carter during his administration from 1977 to 1981. Upon his passing, Jimmy Carter called Mondale “a dear friend” and “the best vice president in our country’s history.”

question_sentence: Former police officer Derek Chauvin was convicted on two counts of murder and one count of manslaughter in the death of George Floyd last May. According to video of the incident, how long did Chauvin kneel on Floyd’s neck during the deadly encounter?
choices: The court concluded that the timing wasn’t clear
evidence: Prosecutors opened their arguments with the total time Floyd spent under Chauvin’s knee: Nine minutes and 29 seconds. The defense accepted this new timing, which was updated from the famous eight minutes, 46 seconds estimate. The verdict has brought a measure of justice to a painful chapter of the Black Lives Matter era.

question_sentence: The world of European club football was rocked this week when several of its top teams announced plans for what kind of project?
choices: a new, elite league made up of the best teams
an XFL-style league involving new rules and playing styles
a new all-star squad that would feature top players from the participating teams
a player boycott of the World Cup
evidence: Twelve teams announced grand plans for a new “super league,” which would feature 20 total high-achieving teams that would break away from other European football competitions. The idea was met with swift and widespread ire from fans, and now it’s not clear how, exactly, it will advance.

question_sentence: The President of this African country died this week after a clash with a rebel group that has been trying to oust him for years.
evidence: Idriss Deby, the President of Chad, died on the front lines of a skirmish with rebels. Chad has been an instrumental force in fighting Boko Haram in the region, and there are fears Deby’s death could trigger an imbalance among neighboring countries.

question_sentence: How many congressional districts are there in the US? (These are the areas represented by United States House members.)
evidence: There are 435 congressional districts in the US, and only 16 of them are represented by a House member who is not of the same party that the district voted for in the 2020 presidential race. These lawmakers are sometimes called “congressional unicorns.”

question_sentence: Alexey Navalny, the jailed Russian opposition leader, has ended this weeks-long form of protest amid widespread concern from his supporters.
evidence: Navalny has ended his hunger strike after doctors warned him he was close to death. The Kremlin critic had been refusing food to protest poor access to medical care in the Russian penal colony where he remains imprisoned.

question_sentence: The 93rd Academy Awards are Sunday. How many women received nominations over the awards’ 24 categories? (Note: Some women received more than one nomination across different categories.)
evidence: Seventy women received a total 76 nominations, according to the Academy, a record for a given year.

question_sentence: Amazon has opened an unusual type of business in London. What is it?
evidence: Amazon is opening a two-story hair salon equipped with fancy technology like augmented reality hair consultations and multimedia product information displays.
